intro: Mesembryanthemum intervallare, commonly known as the "Pillow Bush," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and adaptations to arid environments. The plant produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fleshy, often hairy leaves help store water, making it drought-tolerant. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
